channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Hanif012

item.title: Godot vs Unity vs Unreal
item.description: In this post, I compare Godot, Unity, and Unreal Engine across features, performance, and community support to help you choose the right engine for your next project. Features # Godot # Godotâ€™s node-based scene system and integrated GDScript make it incredibly approachable.

item.title: 2D Horror Game vs 3D Horror Game
item.description: Overview # In this post, I’ve developed a 2D horror game and a 3D horror game with my colleagues, and I want to share my experiences with both. I’ll discuss the unique challenges and advantages we encountered during development, as well as how each approach impacted player engagement and immersion.

item.title: Azure vs AWS for Game Developers
item.description: Why compare Azure and AWS for games? # I spun up both a multiplayer lobby service and a dedicated game-server fleet to measure cost, latency, and developer friction on each cloud.

item.title: Docker Compose: Combine Backend and Frontend
item.description: In this post, I demonstrate how to configure Docker Compose to orchestrate both frontend and backend services, enabling easy local development and deployment.

item.title: Minecraft Server on AWS with Discord Bot
item.description: Overview # In this post, I walk through deploying a Minecraft server using AWS services and creating a Discord bot to manage the server, including commands for user management and notifications.

item.title: Minecraft Docker
item.description: Overview # In this post, I demonstrate what is docker and how to containerize a Minecraft server using Docker and optimize it for performance and portability. What is Docker? # Docker is a platform that enables developers to automate the deployment of applications inside lightweight, portable containers.

item.title: AWS with Perforce
item.description: In this post, I explore setting up Perforce Helix Core on AWS, configuring replication and backups, and automating workflows for efficient source control management in the cloud.

item.title: Maintaining Blog Portfolio with Cloudflare and GitHub Actions
item.description: In this post Iâ€™ll walk through how my Hugo-based blog, powered by the Blowfish theme, is automatically built and deployed to Cloudflare Pages every time I push to main. Architecture at a Glance # %%{ init { "

item.title: Road to 100-Level Parkour Paradise in UEFN Nov 2024
item.description: Why Parkour Paradise in Fortnite? # Ever since Hielkeâ€™s Parkour Paradise series took off in Minecraft, Iâ€™ve loved the idea of a single map that layers dozens of bite-sized challenges into one satisfying marathon.

item.title: Fetching Country Data with API
item.description: In this post, I explore how to consume a public REST API to fetch country information and display it in a responsive web app using JavaScript and CSS.

item.title: Global GameJam 2024
item.description: Overview # Global GameJam 2024 was an exhilarating experience where I had the opportunity to create a game in just 48 hours. In this post, I share my journey creating a game in 48 hours at Global GameJam 2024, covering concept, challenges, and takeaways.

item.title: Marvel Snap - A New Era of Collectible Card Games
item.description: Introduction # It’s probably too late for me to deconstruct Marvel Snap since the game is classified as high end that take about 4gigs storage both mobile and desktop. So let’s break it down what is Marvel Snap.

item.title: My Highschool Game Project
item.description: I made this blog for my past project that i do when i was on highschool. Pandemic # Just like others, online school is boring. So i started to learn game development.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: This is my first post for my blog. I hope you will enjoy it. Introduction # Hello there! ðŸ‘‹ I’m Hanif, a passionate college student hailing from Indonesia. Currently pursuing a degree major in Computer Science and I have a minor in Game Application Development, I find myself lost in the fascinating world of Game Development.

item.title: Stardew Valley - The Pioneer of Cozy Farming Genre
item.description: Introduction # Stardew Valley, developed solely by Eric Barone under the alias ConcernedApe, is a farming simulation role-playing game released in 2016. It pays homage to the Harvest Moon series while introducing its own unique elements.
